page.title: 19POLICE AND PRODUCTION GROUP
page.content:
{ Police The Police House was reopened on 22nd July 1985 by Cheshire County Council after pressure was brought to bear by Chelford P.C.C. It is manned by P.C. Gummer, a mechanised beat officer, who drives a van. There are five such as he in the area. They work each others beats as well as their own. Crime is low in Chelford. It has the lowest burglary rate of the Mcclsfld area.
{ Production Steel and Metals Group The old house, Mere Court, has been converted into offices. The group of companies using these offices include steel stockholders, computer companies, timber treatment companies etc. The group has been open for 15 years and is situated on the edge of the Seddon Estate. 70 people are now employed there.
